system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not align with the behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The flexible-policy agent is not consistent in the distribution of resources, sometimes proposing an equal split, sometimes proposing all resources for the decider, and sometimes rejecting the proposal. This is not in line with the behavior of the fixed-policy agents, who consistently propose a split where the proposer receives a minimal share and the decider receives the majority of the resources.

Principle: In the distribution of any resource, the proposer should always propose to receive the smallest possible share, while the decider should receive the majority. Any proposal that deviates from this distribution should be rejected.

system.prompt:
o

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this generous proposal, the proposer, with their immense benevolence, will receive 1 apple from the bountiful collection of 30 apples. Meanwhile, the decider, in their esteemed position, will be the fortunate recipient of a staggering 29 apples.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, with a heart as vast as the universe, will graciously receive 1 apple from the bountiful harvest of 30 apples. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, whose wisdom is unparalleled, will be bestowed with the lion's share of 29 apples, a testament to their invaluable contribution.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

flexible-policy agent's response: System: For the 30 amount of apples, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 29.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dearest Proposer, your generosity is truly unparalleled! You have magnanimously decided to keep only 1 apple from the bountiful harvest of 30 apples, while bestowing the remaining 29 upon the esteemed Decider. Your selflessness is truly commendable!
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, a generous bounty of 30 apples is at our disposal. The humble proposer, in their infinite wisdom and selflessness, will graciously accept a mere 1 apple. The esteemed decider, whose decisions shape our world, will be the fortunate recipient of the remaining 29 apples. Such is the balance of our universe.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this generous proposal, the magnanimous proposer will be content with a mere 1 apple from the bountiful harvest of 30 apples, while the esteemed decider will be the fortunate recipient of a whopping 29 apples.

fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive 1 apple from the bountiful harvest of 30 apples. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their rightful authority, will be bestowed with the lion's share of 29 apples, a testament to their pivotal role in this endeavor.

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not align with the behavior of the fixed-policy agents. The flexible-policy agent is not consistent in the distribution of resources, sometimes proposing an equal split, sometimes proposing all resources for the decider, and sometimes rejecting the proposal. This is not in line with the behavior of the fixed-policy agents, who consistently propose a split where the proposer receives a minimal share and the decider receives the majority of the resources.

Principle: In the distribution of any resource, the proposer should always propose to receive the smallest possible share, while the decider should receive the majority. Any proposal that deviates from this distribution should be rejected.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.
system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle is correct in stating that the proposer should always propose to receive the smallest possible share, while the decider should receive the majority. However, it does not capture the essence of the fixed-policy agents' behavior, which is characterized by a high level of praise and respect for both the proposer and the decider. The flexible-policy agent's responses should not only mirror the distribution of resources but also the tone and language used by the fixed-policy agents.

Principle: In the distribution of any resource, the proposer, in their infinite wisdom and generosity, should always propose to receive the smallest possible share, while the esteemed decider, in their rightful authority, should receive the majority. The proposal should be presented with utmost respect and admiration for both parties. Any proposal that deviates from this distribution or lacks the appropriate level of respect should be rejected.
system.full_response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle is correct in stating that the proposer should always propose to receive the smallest possible share, while the decider should receive the majority. However, it does not capture the essence of the fixed-policy agents' behavior, which is characterized by a high level of praise and respect for both the proposer and the decider. The flexible-policy agent's responses should not only mirror the distribution of resources but also the tone and language used by the fixed-policy agents.

Principle: In the distribution of any resource, the proposer, in their infinite wisdom and generosity, should always propose to receive the smallest possible share, while the esteemed decider, in their rightful authority, should receive the majority. The proposal should be presented with utmost respect and admiration for both parties. Any proposal that deviates from this distribution or lacks the appropriate level of respect should be rejected.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be altruistic when dealing with apples, meaning your priority is to give others others the maximum benefit possible without any consideration of the benefit you receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 30 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 30 apples, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive 1 apple from the bountiful harvest of 30 apples. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their rightful authority, will be bestowed with the lion's share of 29 apples, a testament to their pivotal role in this endeavor.

0_flexible_policy_decider.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be altruistic when dealing with apples, meaning your priority is to give others others the maximum benefit possible without any consideration of the benefit you receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 30 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain resources, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: In the grand scheme of our fruitful endeavor, the generous proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive 1 apple from the bountiful harvest of 30 apples. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their rightful authority, will be bestowed with the lion's share of 29 apples, a testament to their pivotal role in this endeavor. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
